title: Software Design Co-op Intern (May-Dec)
raw description:
Responsibilities

When you work at Daktronics, you’ll be part of something amazing. We design, engineer, manufacture and support bold, eye-catching digital LED and LCD video displays and audio systems.

Our products bring excitement to professional, college and high school games. They attract customers for businesses around the world, and even provide direction for people as they travel, work and play.

As part of the Daktronics team, you’ll have interesting, impactful work with flexible opportunities. You can learn and grow at a company that provides competitive compensation and meaningful benefits – and the people are second to none.

Learn more About Daktronics !

When and where is this opportunity?

Position has the flexibility to work from a US based home office and/or at the Brookings, SD or Rapid City, SD Daktronics campuses. This position is open to candidates eligible to work in the U.S.

Internship opportunities available:
14 May 2024 to 13 December 2024 – Check out our Daktronics Internship Video .
If your university quarter/semester doesn’t end until after these dates, we may consider an alternate schedule.

What will work look like for me?

At Daktronics, you’ll experience challenging and meaningful work; you’ll have a mentor who will challenge you to find solutions, take initiative, and develop a strong understanding of Daktronics products, practices, and procedures. We will make sure you have the knowledge needed to be successful to hit the ground running!

As a Daktronics Software Intern, you will put your degree to the test using cutting edge technology to troubleshoot and test production code for high-end video processing used by real customers. You will write code to enhance existing Daktronics software components by adding features or tracking down and fixing bugs. You will actively engage in business transactions and experience the satisfaction of knowing that something that wasn’t working yesterday is working for our customer today because of your software solutions and problem-solving skills. And sometimes, you will even see your work on national television!

You will also work with a team of developers and professionals to design, develop, and deliver software solutions to various Daktronics customers and business groups. You will primarily focus on:

Application Development: Enhancement and maintenance of our current applications and solutions along with design and development of new software applications using Microsoft Visual Studio.
Programming Languages: Most of the work would be done in the C#, JavaScript, and Typescript software development languages.
Team Collaboration: Work within a larger development team to solve problems.
Testing and Documentation: Write unit tests for existing code along with assisting in the development of software product requirements and design documentation.
Perform other duties as assigned or needed to support the efforts of Daktronics.

Who are the Software Development teams at Daktronics?

Daktronics software teams support everything from internal applications and tools to software solutions and products used by our customers. We are excited to bring someone on board that cares deeply about growing professionally and challenging themselves. We are passionate about solving the right problems, the right way. We challenge each other every day and expect the best from each other. We respect each other and those we work with very much, while welcoming differing viewpoints and suggestions. We work hard and we have a lot of fun!

Pay And Perks

The typical hiring pay for this position is $24.00 to $26.00. The actual pay offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including relevant education/experiences.

We also offer financial Relocation Assistance for positions that require placement in a specific location.

This position will be eligible for company benefits including, employee discount program, employee assistance program, community donation program, unpaid time off, 401(k), Employee Stock Purchase Plan, leaves, disability, and accommodations.

This information is intended to be a general overview and may be modified by Daktronics due to factors affecting the business.

Qualifications

Academic Requirements:
Candidate must be enrolled as a full-time student and registered for at least 12 credits (undergraduate) or 9 credits (graduate) at the time of application.
Preferred candidate would be pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, or related field.
Preferred candidate would be at least junior status in school.
Ability to take a semester off from school to complete the internship, if not a graduate.
Ability to work through the Cooperative Education/Internship Program at your accredited university and Faculty Coordinator to arrange for credit while participating in this 7-month internship, as needed.
Students eligible to start the internship the semester immediately following undergraduate bachelor’s degree graduation will also be considered.
Only strong academic performers will be considered; with preference to 3.0 GPA or greater.
Must be able to commit to 40 hours per week.
Unofficial transcripts or web transcripts must be submitted with application to be considered for this internship.

Preferred Experiences

Object oriented programming knowledge is required. Knowledge of C++, C#, or Java preferred, but other object-oriented languages are acceptable.
Knowledge of the Microsoft.Net Framework and Visual Studio.
Knowledge of GIT or other source control software.

Other Requirements

Candidates must be 18 years of age or older.
Must be able to commit to 40 hours per week.
Good oral and written communication skills, good organizational skills, self-motivation.
Good problem solving and critical thinking skills.
Ability to work effectively as a member of a team.
Dedication and desire for quality performance.
Fluent in English, both written and verbal.

You will collaborate with manufacturing, R&D, and marketing teams world-wide through the development of Keysight’s new test and measurement products until successful launch into a production environment. The New Product Introduction (NPI) team performs design validation, test creation, and performance analysis for all new products during development. This is your opportunity to join a team that's bringing new products and technologies to the market faster and more efficiently than ever before!

About the Team:

Our NPI teams are multi-disciplinary, involving electrical engineering and software engineering. As an NPI (New Product Introduction) Engineer Intern, you will apply your Electrical Engineering and Software Engineering schooling, knowledge, and skills to one or more focused hands-on projects and have the opportunity to become a measurement expert yourself! – Mastering technical understanding of early hardware designs to influence design and project schedules with respect to DfM

– Turn on and troubleshoot boards and systems

– Develop and implement manufacturing and characterization tests for new products

– Identify new test equipment, time, etc. for new product hardware

– Develop and own test architecture and algorithms for product characterization and mass production.

– Create technical documentation – test support docs, troubleshooting docs, training docs, etc.

– Characterize product performance and ensure reliability

– Review and validate Datasheets to ensure alignment with manufacturing tests

– Drive knowledge transfer of technical expertise and processes to production team

– Support and implement the transition of products and manufacturing processes from prototype to full production

Projected Responsibilities of NPI Intern:

With guidance from a mentor(s)

– Work on a real project or projects supporting our current NPI projects/products underway

– Develop new architecture and modules for characterizing high-performance oscilloscope (scope) hardware

– Lead the final phase of migration to latest remote control of high-performance scopes

– Using Agile workflow, work directly with UXR-Series scope and test rack equipment to evaluate new scope function and performance validation

– Additionally use UXR-Series scope to manually ensure warranted hardware specifications are appropriately migrating to next generation of high-performance scopes

Other responsibilities may include:

– Working through product board turn on during prototype phases of next generation high-performance scopes

– Perform troubleshooting at product board level as required

– Characterize hardware performance at board or product level

Undergraduate student pursuing a combination of degree program / program courses covering both Hardware and Software including BS in Electrical Engineering, BS in Computer Science, or related major.

Experience with software development, source control, and test

Understanding of Statistical Analysis

Team player with a positive attitude

Job Description

BAE Systems is seeking an exceptional Intern or Co-op for an exciting opportunity to support the Air Force's Intercontinental Ballistic Missile (ICBM) program. Why BAE Systems? BAE Systems is the third largest defense contractor in the world with an exceptional, mission-focused culture. The 800+ BAE Systems employees and sub-contractors located at Hill Air Force Base, Utah are closely aligned to the United States Air Force Nuclear Weapons Center. We support the Center in sustaining the existing LGM-30 Minuteman III (MM III) weapon system. The MM III is a strategic nuclear weapon system dispersed in hardened silos to protect against attack, and connected to an underground launch control center through a system of hardened cables. Over 50 years of continuous modernization programs have resulted in new versions of the missile, expanded targeting options, and improved accuracy and survivability. These enhancements serve to keep the MM III viable as until the mid-2030s, when the system is scheduled to be replaced by the future GBSD ICBM now in development.

We are a uniquely-valued mission partner delivering daily technical excellence and innovative solutions to our government customers.
